org.threadly.concurrent

Class TaskSchedulerDistributor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskExecutorDistributor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskSchedulerDistributor

  • public class TaskSchedulerDistributor
extends TaskExecutorDistributor
    This is a class which is more full featured than TaskExecutorDistributor, but it does require a scheduler implementation in order to be able to perform scheduling.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.threadly.concurrent.TaskExecutorDistributor

        CONCURRENT_HASH_MAP_LOAD_FACTOR, CONCURRENT_HASH_MAP_MAX_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL, CONCURRENT_HASH_MAP_MAX_INITIAL_SIZE, DEFAULT_LOCK_PARALISM, DEFAULT_THREAD_KEEPALIVE_TIME, executor, sLock

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism, int maxThreadCount)
      Constructor which creates scheduler based off provided values.
      TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism, SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler)
      Constructor to use a provided scheduler implementation for running tasks.
      TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler)
      Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks.
      TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler, StripedLock sLock)
      Constructor to be used in unit tests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism,
                        int maxThreadCount)
        Constructor which creates scheduler based off provided values. This is a more full featured task distributor, it allows scheduling and recurring tasks
        Parameters:
        expectedParallism - Expected number of keys that will be used in parallel
        maxThreadCount - Max thread count (limits the qty of keys which are handled in parallel)

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(int expectedParallism,
                        SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler)
        Constructor to use a provided scheduler implementation for running tasks.
        Parameters:
        expectedParallism - level of expected qty of threads adding tasks in parallel
        scheduler - A multi-threaded scheduler to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskSchedulerDistributor

        public TaskSchedulerDistributor(SimpleSchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        StripedLock sLock)
        Constructor to be used in unit tests. This allows you to provide a StripedLock that provides a TestableLockFactory so that this class can be used with the TestablePriorityScheduler.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - scheduler to be used for task worker execution
        sLock - lock to be used for controlling access to workers

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public void schedule(java.lang.Object threadKey,
            java.lang.Runnable task,
            long delayInMs)
        Schedule a task with a given delay.
        Parameters:
        threadKey - object key where hashCode will be used to determine execution thread
        task - Task to execute
        delayInMs - Time to wait to execute task

      • scheduleWithFixedDelay

        public void scheduleWithFixedDelay(java.lang.Object threadKey,
                          java.lang.Runnable task,
                          long initialDelay,
                          long recurringDelay)
        Schedule a recurring task to run. The recurring delay time will be from the point where execution finished.
        Parameters:
        threadKey - object key where hashCode will be used to determine execution thread
        task - Task to be executed.
        initialDelay - Delay in milliseconds until first run.
        recurringDelay - Delay in milliseconds for running task after last finish.
